page.title: 08The Old Bakery.
page.content: On Tuesday 26th June,Class 3 went to visit Mrs Birk's house which is the old bakery of Chelsfield.The history of the house is interesting.At first Mrs Birks did not like the name"The Old Bakery" so she let the lady next door have it for hers.One day Mrs.Birks received a letter saying that she could not change the name of the house unless she got special permission. The old Bakery is over 300 years and is a listed building.People in the village have made a soceity to protect old buildings and make sure that they do not get knocked down or changed. In the past the village baker would bake the bread inside the bakery then take it round the village on his horse and cart.The baker would keep his horse in his garden and every day he had to lead it through his front room and out the back into the stables at the rear.
